title: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data
text: Group testing cost-effective strategy identifying positive cases population prevalence low. dorfman function gtm package implements two-stage Dorfman group testing algorithm, includes group testing follow-individual testing group found positive. vignette explains use function interpret output, focus accounting imperfect sensitivity specificity.

title: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data
text: Samples pooled groups size c. group test result simulated based true status group: P(Zg=1|Yg)={Se[1]∑Yg>01−Sp[1]otherwise P(Z_g = 1|Y_g) = \begin{cases} Se[1] & \text{} \sum Y_g > 0 \\ 1-Sp[1] & \text{otherwise} \end{cases} member positive group tested individually: P(Zi=1|Yi)={Se[2]Yi=11−Sp[2]otherwise P(Z_i = 1|Y_i) = \begin{cases} Se[2] & \text{} Y_i = 1 \\ 1-Sp[2] & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}

title: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data
text: Samples pooled groups size c. group test result simulated based true status group: P(Zg=1|Yg)={Se[1]∑Yg>01−Sp[1]otherwise P(Z_g = 1|Y_g) = \begin{cases} Se[1] & \text{} \sum Y_g > 0 \\ 1-Sp[1] & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}

title: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data
text: member positive group tested individually: P(Zi=1|Yi)={Se[2]Yi=11−Sp[2]otherwise P(Z_i = 1|Y_i) = \begin{cases} Se[2] & \text{} Y_i = 1 \\ 1-Sp[2] & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}

title: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data
text: Y.true: Vector true individual statuses (0 = negative, 1 = positive) Se: Vector sensitivities group individual tests Sp: Vector specificities group individual tests c: Integer group size (must evenly divide length Y.true) result$Z contains group individual test results. result$Y tracks individual’s test outcomes IDs. Columns result$Z: Test result (0/1), Group size, Test type (1 = group, 2 = individual), Sample indices Columns result$Y: - Final test result, - Number tests, - Group test ID, - Individual test ID (applicable)

title: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data
text: Y.true: Vector true individual statuses (0 = negative, 1 = positive) Se: Vector sensitivities group individual tests Sp: Vector specificities group individual tests c: Integer group size (must evenly divide length Y.true)

title: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data
text: result$Z contains group individual test results. result$Y tracks individual’s test outcomes IDs. Columns result$Z: Test result (0/1), Group size, Test type (1 = group, 2 = individual), Sample indices Columns result$Y: - Final test result, - Number tests, - Group test ID, - Individual test ID (applicable)

title: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data
text: dorfman function provides simulation-based decoder Dorfman’s group testing design. ideal researchers analyzing test performance imperfect conditions, simulating group testing workflows low-prevalence scenarios.

title: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data

title: Dorfman Group Testing Decoder — dorfman
text: Implements two-stage Dorfman group testing algorithm sensitivity specificity considerations.

title: Dorfman Group Testing Decoder — dorfman
text: Y.true Numeric vector (n x 1) true binary statuses (1=positive, 0=negative) Se Numeric vector length 2: (group sensitivity, individual sensitivity) Sp Numeric vector length 2: (group specificity, individual specificity) c Integer group size (must divide length(Y.true))

title: Dorfman Group Testing Decoder — dorfman
text: List : Z Test results matrix (J x (c+3)) columns :             [Test result, Group size, Test type (1=group, 2=individual), Sample indices] Y Individual results matrix (n x 4) columns :             [Test result, Test type, Group test ID, Individual test ID]

title: Dorfman Group Testing Decoder — dorfman
text: function performs: Group testing: Samples pooled groups size c tested Individual testing: group tests positive, members tested individually probability models used: $$P(Z_g = 1|Y_g) = \begin{cases} Se[1] & \text{} \sum Y_g > 0 \\ 1-Sp[1] & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}$$ $$P(Z_i = 1|Y_i) = \begin{cases} Se[2] & \text{} Y_i = 1 \\ 1-Sp[2] & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}$$ \(Z_g\) group test result, \(Z_i\) individual test result, \(Y_g\), \(Y_i\) true statuses.

what: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data — gtm
title: gtm: Modeling Group Testing Data — gtm
text: gtm package provides tools modeling analyzing group testing data. includes functions fitting models, evaluating performance, visualizing results.
